org.orgName: United States District Court, For the Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: Received a copy of the within Petition this 22 day of July 1915 H & Hammond Geo. R. Tennant Attorney for Petitioner
IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON. NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of LEWIS JOHNSON, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
RETURN
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JUL 22 1915 FRANK L. CROSBY, Clerk, By Emd Deputy 2x
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of LEWIS JOHNSON, for a WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
NO. ORDER DIRECTING ISSUANCE OF WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.

Upon the application of the petitioner herein, Lewis Johnson, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, it appearing to the Court from said application that said Petitioner has been deprived of his liberty illegally by John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division.

NOW THEREFORE, It is Hereby ORDERED and ADJUDGED that the said John M. Boyle, United States Marshal for the Western District of Washington, produce the said petitioner, Lewis Johnson, before the above entitled Court on the 22nd day of July, A.D. 1915, at the hour of 2 o'clock PM., then and there to do and receive what shall be ordered concerning said petitioner, and that said John M. Boyle, aforesaid, have then and there with him, the Writ hereby ordered issued herein.

It is further ORDERED and ADJUDGED that John C. Whitlock, United States Commissioner for the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, be, and he is hereby ordered and directed to forthwith certify to this Court all proceedings had and done before the said John C. Whitlock, concerning the arrest and imprisonment of said Lewis Johnson.
Done in Open Court this 21st day of July, A.D. 1915. Jeremiah Neterer JUDGE.
United States District Court Western District Northern Division
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF LEWIS JOHNSON FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS.
ORDER DIRECTING ISSUANCE OF WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JUL 21 1915 FRANK L. CROSBY. Clerk, By Emd Deputy 2x Hammond & Hammond
GEORGE R. TENNANT ATTORNEY FOR Petitioner Mutual Life BUILDING SEATTLE, WASH.
THE IVY PRESS, SEATTLE
United States District Court for the Western District of Washington
In the Matter of the application of Lewis Johnson for a Writ of Habeas Corpus
No. 3077 Appearance
To the Clerk of the above Entitled Court:

You will please enter our appearace as attorneys for Lewis Johnson in the above entitled cause, and service of all subsequent papers, except writs and process, may be made upon said Lewis Johnson, by leaving the same with GEO R. Tennant H & Hammond Office Address Mutual Life BLDG. Seattle.
NOTICE-Attorneys will please endorse their own Filings. Rule 11.
